alternatePhrases: coproduct in the category of topological spaces
definition:
Given two topological spaces $X$ and $Y$, their *topological sum* is
defined to be the set $X \coprod Y$ (see the entry *disjoint union*)
equipped with the finest topology such that the inclusion maps from $X$
and $Y$ into $X \coprod Y$ are continuous. A basis for this topology
consists of the union of the set of open subsets of $X$ and the set of
open subsets of $Y$.
